DP106 - What's New in ONESOURCE Tax Provision

Tuesday, November 13


1


Shannon is a Senior Product Manager with Thomson Reuters. In the eighteen years she has been with Thomson Reuters, she has held positions in the ONESOURCE Data Query and Excel Add-In product group, the ONESOURCE Direct Support group and the Quality Assurance Group for the ONESOURCE products.

Prior to joining Thomson Reuters, Shannon worked as a Tax Accountant for HP (then EDS) and for Chisum & Morton, PC, CPAs, a local firm. She holds a BBA in Accounting degree from West Texas A&M University.

In her free time, when she isn’t cheering her daughters from the sidelines of their many sporting and production events, you can find Shannon lacing up her own tennis shoes and hitting the pavement for a mind-freeing, stress relieving, long distance run.


Savita is a Senior Product Manager, managing the roadmaps and business support for Tax Provision, Global Access, Uncertain Tax Positions, and State Apportionment. Before joining the Product Management team, Savita spent three years as a Solution Consultant demoing the ONESOURCE Suite to current and prospective clients.

Prior to joining Thomson Reuters, Savita was a Tax Manager at a Fortune 500 multinational company in the Tax Technology Group where she was responsible for executing technology initiatives across all functions of the tax department and identifying areas in need of process improvement.

Savita received her undergraduate degree in Accounting from Dallas

Baptist University. She lives with her husband, Luke, and their son, Gyan, in Houston, TX.

DP108A – ONESOURCE Tax Provision Version 2016 Basics

Monday, November 12

9:45 AM – 10:40 AM


1


Warren Jagger


  • Warren Jagger is currently an Associate Solution Consultant for ONESOURCE. He has been with Thomson Reuters for over 4 years and previously was on the Client Success team acting as an advocate for Provision only and Express RS only clients.

  • In his current role, Warren aims to educate current and prospective clients on ONESOURCE solutions with a focus on Provision.

  • Warren holds a Bachelor’s Degree in Applied Mathematics from The College of New Jersey and a Masters of Business Administration from Fairleigh Dickinson University.


Confidential and Proprietary


Objectives

Upon completion, attendees will be able to identify the new navigational steps and processes associated with the v2016 ONESOURCE Tax Provision application.


Agenda


  • Overview: ONESOURCE Tax Provision v2016

  • Prepare a Federal Provision

  • Prepare a State Provision

  • Jobs

  • ONESOURCE Workpapers


    Confidential and Proprietary


    Overview: ONESOURCE Tax Provision v2016




    5


    v2016 Significant Features

  • Removal of Citrix Layer – Zero client footprint

  • Support for multiple browsers and tablet-friendly

  • One click to go to Tax Provision’s homepage (Orange Application tiles)

  • One click to go to the last visited page in Tax Provision’s new Review and Edit area (White Recent Work tiles)

  • Review data from consolidated amounts to the lowest level detail in 2 clicks

  • New Data Entry grids that allow data entry and review of multiple datasets, units and jurisdictions

  • Most importantly, the underlying calculation and reporting functionality has not changed. v2016 simply provides a more efficient process for navigating thorough the application.


v2014 vs. v2016 User Interface




v2014 vs. v2016 User Interface


1

2

3

4

Home Screen


  1. Global Navigation Bar


  2. Product Menu Bar


  3. My Applications Titles


  4. Recent Work Tiles


Home Screen

  • ONESOURCE Tax Provision Choices



    Home Screen

  • Select ONESOURCE Tax Provision



    All Datasets

  • Datasets are the primary building block of the system. So, it is from here that you should begin to use the application.



    All Datasets

  • To expand the capabilities of drilling into the details of the Dataset and have access to and post data to Units, you first Add Datasets to your Review List.


    Manage Units

  • After Datasets have been added to My Review List of Datasets, click on the number in the Units column, for a specific Dataset, to Activate Units for that Dataset.



    Manage Units

  • Select specific Units or all Units to Activate.



    Manage Units

  • Add Jurisdictions to the Units in addition to Federal

    Confidential and Proprietary

  • Clicking Fed will hyperlink to the Add Jurisdictions screen where you can add / activate states.





    Review & Edit

  • Entering and reviewing data for jurisdictions is accomplished in the Review & Edit section by clicking Review & Edit in the top navigation bar or clicking REVIEW from My Datasets for Review.



    Review & Edit

  • From Review & Edit, select a Lead Sheet, a Data Entry screen or one of the four data and calculation views, such as Total Tax Provision



    Review & Edit

  • Unit drill down navigation provides a focused view of the data and calculations




    Review & Edit

  • Click amounts to hyperlink to detail




    Review & Edit

  • Hyperlinked detail



    Review & Edit

  • Grids are multi-Unit and multi-jurisdictional



    Review & Edit

    Confidential and Proprietary

  • Filter multi-Unit or multi-jurisdictional grids


    Review & Edit

  • Comparison View




    Reporting

  • Select Reporting from the top navigation bar to generate reports.



    Reporting

  • The Dataset and Reporting Level chosen in Reporting will determine the available report choices



    Reporting

  • Options include page formatting (Freeze, Gridlines, etc.), View and Breakout choices, and Class choices




    Reporting

  • Click the Footnotes icon to add text to bottom of a report



    Reporting

  • My Reports allows for the creation of user defined report folders and batch printing.



Prepare a Federal Provision




30


Unit Properties: General



Unit Properties: Rates



Pre-Tax Book Income

  • Review & Edit – Data Entry: Pre-Tax Book Income



    Pre-Tax Book Income

  • Review & Edit – Provision Lead Sheet: Pre-Tax Book Income




Permanent Differences – Initial Creation



Permanent Differences – Add to a Unit



Temporary Differences – Initial Creation



Temporary Differences – Add to a Unit



NOLs – Enable Current Year Automation



Bridge Trial Balance

  • The Trial Balance Bridge allows you to import a trial balance into ONESOURCE and, from there, automate the calculation of

    • Pre-tax Book Income

    • Permanent Difference

    • Temporary Difference

  • Imported trial balances can also be used to

    • Compute the FX rate used for the system

    • Import in trial balance sublines (for use in tax basis balance sheets or workpapers)

    • Import in tax accounts for use in computing the journal entry


      Bridge Trial Balance

  • Trial Balance Automation is administered in the Administration / Manage Bridge section




    Bridge Trial Balance

  • Trial Balances are imported at the dataset level




    Bridge Trial Balance

    Confidential and Proprietary

  • Every time a trial balance is bridged you have the option to select which components to automate


    Bridge Trial Balance

  • Individual units’ trial balances, or a consolidated trial balance, can be imported




    Bridge Trial Balance

  • Files can be taken from a users hard drive in one of several specified formats, or imported via General Ledger Manager


    Bridge Trial Balance

  • The results of the import can be previewed prior to submission



    Prepare a State Provision




    47


    Apportionment Rates

  • After states have been activated, state data entry and other functions are then available



    Blended States

  • Many companies calculate a Blended State rate outside of the system and use this rate as the statutory rate

  • In this case, the Apportionment % would be 100% and the tax rate would be the calculated blended rate.


    Mass Update Rates

  • Mass Update Rates are Maintained in Administration, Manage States



    State by State Perms and Temps

  • Set Federal Perms and Temps to be used on a state-by-state percentage basis

  • These settings can be entered as a template in Administration and copied to Datasets, or entered Dataset by Dataset



    State Usage of Federal Perms and Temps

  • Use a Federal perm to modify and amount for a specific State



    State NOLs

  • The NOL will be input by the system on the State After App Temp Difference Screen

  • The system will post a reclass to create the NOL Temporary difference when the unit has a taxable loss or will draw down an available NOL Temporary Difference when the unit has taxable income


    Jobs




    54


    Overview

  • Jobs is a repository of your prior and current imports and exports. Jobs details the status of imports and exports and provides access to the import and export logs. It also enables the user to download a pivot-table ready Excel spreadsheet for data exported files

  • A significant feature of the Jobs functionality is that imports and exports are processed as asynchronous tasks, meaning the user can continue to work in the application while the imports and exports are being processed


    Overview

  • Spreadsheet Imports


    Overview

  • Provision Lead Sheet Export

    • When exporting a Lead Sheet, such as the Provision Lead Sheet, the system generates a 2-tab pivot table file



      Overview

  • Provision Lead Sheet Export

    • The first tab is named Calculated Data. The second tab is namedTotal Tax Provision, as in this example:



      ONESOURCE Workpapers




      59


      Overview

  • ONESOURCE Workpapers is a two pronged functionality.

    • Platform level/web-based repository for workpapers providing control, transparency, and organization

    • ONESOURCE and Excel integration point allowing the ability to push and pull data to and from applications

  • ONESOURCE Workpapers and ONESOURCE Tax Provision Usage Examples:

    • Singular cell push and pulls: adjustments, system codes, and calculated values

    • Range GETs/table extracts from ONESOURCE Tax Provision

    • ONESOURCE integration: Income Tax, General Ledger Manager, Transfer Pricing, etc.


      Texas Gross Margin

  • Singular Cell Pull & ONESOURCE Integration

    Provision Leadsheet

  • Range GETS: One Mapping, Multiple Data Points



For more Workpapers insights, please join our ONESOURCE Workpaper Synergy Sessions


Thank You

DP109A – ONESOURCE Workpapers Basics

Monday, November 12

12:50 pm – 1:45 pm


1


Warren Jagger


Warren Jagger is currently an Associate Solution Consultant for ONESOURCE. He has been with Thomson Reuters for over 4 years and previously was on the Client Success team acting as an advocate for Provision only and Express RS only clients.

In his current role, Warren aims to educate current and prospective clients on ONESOURCE solutions with a focus on Provision.

Warren holds a Bachelor’s Degree in Applied Mathematics from The College of New Jersey and a Masters of Business Administration from Fairleigh Dickinson University.


Objectives

Upon completion, attendees will be able to identify the key features, benefits, and navigational processes for the ONESOURCE Workpapers application.


Agenda slide


  • Introduction

  • Mappings: SET

  • Mappings: GET

  • Mappings: Range

  • Mappings: What’s New

  • Storage and Management


    Introduction




    5


    Data Management Tools

  • Prior to ONESOURCE Workpapers, clients could use various data management tools to either populate ONESOURCE applications with data and calculations or extract data and calculations from those applications

  • The goal of ONESOURCE Workpapers is to provide a single data management tool for use with all ONESOURCE applications

  • The two data management tools typically used by ONESOURCE Tax Provision users were Active Workpapers and Excel Add-in

  • These tools can continue to be utilized by clients who have not yet upgraded to v2016 Provision


    Data Management Tools

  • For clients who have upgraded to or are newly licensed users of v2016 Provision, ONESOURCE Workpapers replaces Active Workpapers

  • Excel Add-in (now called Data Import) can continue to be used with v2016 Provision. However, it is anticipated that for Provision users, ONESOURCE Workpapers will eventually replace Data Import


    Migration to Workpapers

  • When a v2014.1 client wants to upgrade to v2016, they contact the ONESOURCE Tax Provision Support Team. The Support team will provide guidance as to the process for migrating current Active Workpapers

  • All Active Workpapers in ONESOURCE Tax Provision will be migrated to ONESOURCE Workpapers

  • There is not an option to choose which active workpapers are migrated to the Workpapers application


    Workpapers Add-in

  • The Workpaper Add-in is an Excel add-in used to design and build Excel workpapers

  • The Add-in must be installed before using ONESOURCE Workpapers




    Workpapers Add-in

  • The Workpaper Add-in is an Excel add-in used to design and build Excel workpapers

  • The Add-in must be installed before using ONESOURCE Workpapers



    Registration and Association

  • Prior to using ONESOURCE Workpapers, it must be Registered with your Provision application / instance




    Registration and Association

  • Similarly, ONESOURCE Workpapers must be Associated with your Provision application / instance




    Mappings: SET




    13


    SET and GET

  • Mappings are formula driven definitions of the cells in a workpaper into which to post data and calculations retrieved from a ONESOURCE application or from which to send data and calculations to a ONESOURCE application

    • GET: Retrieve and post to a workpaper

    • SET: Send to a ONESOURCE application


      SET: Send to a ONESOURCE Application



      SET: Send to a ONESOURCE Application

  • Open the Field Browser to begin the mapping process

  • Select SET data

  • Select a ONESOURCE Application for linkage

  • Select Field to map


    SET: Send to a ONESOURCE Application

  • Drag and drop the Field name onto the workpaper next to the data to be SET

  • IMPORTANT: Your original workpaper will need to be modified to include these Workpaper Formula cells



    SET: Send to a ONESOURCE Application

  • The Formula cells can be located on the spreadsheet wherever your choose

  • However, it is recommended that when your spreadsheet has a range of items to be mapped that the Formula cells be in a column adjacent to the items to be mapped



    SET: Send to a ONESOURCE Application

  • The Function Wizard opens

    Confidential and Proprietary

  • Make the appropriate “Parameter” (Component) selections and click Next





    SET: Send to a ONESOURCE Application

    Target Range

    Formula Cell

  • Either enter the Target Range (cell) and Formula Cell



    SET: Send to a ONESOURCE Application

  • Use the Range Selection buttons to click the cells in the workpaper



    SET: Send to a ONESOURCE Application

  • The mapped cell will display a Ready to Push status

  • Click Send Data to SET/send the data to the application





    SET: Send to a ONESOURCE Application

  • After the data is SET/sent, the mapped cell will display a date and time stamp

  • However, the cell formula is not removed



    SET: Send to a ONESOURCE Application

  • An alternative to using the Field Browser to create SET (or GET) mappings is to use Functions




SET: Send to a ONESOURCE Application



Mappings: GET




26


GET: Retrieve from Provision and post to a Workpaper



GET: Retrieve from Provision and post to a Workpaper

  • Open the Field Browser to begin the mapping process

  • Select GET data

  • Select a ONESOURCE Application for linkage

  • Select Field to map



    GET: Retrieve from Provision and post to a Workpaper

  • Drag and drop the Field name onto the workpaper in the appropriate cell

  • Note: Unlike mappings with the SET function, a separate Formula cell for GET is not needed



    GET: Retrieve from Provision and post to a Workpaper

  • The Function Wizard opens

    Confidential and Proprietary

  • Make the appropriate selections and click Next





    GET: Retrieve from Provision and post to a Workpaper

  • Either enter the Target Range cell or click the Range selection button to click the cell in the workpaper

  • Click Done



    GET: Retrieve from Provision and post to a Workpaper

  • The mapped cell will be populated

  • If your workpaper has a formula in the Variance column, the GET function will trigger the variance calculation


    Mappings: Range




    33


    Range Mapping




    Range Mapping

  • Map the first cell in the range using the cell reference




    Range Mapping




    Range Mapping



    Range Mapping

  • The Target is the cell with the Perm Diff $$ amount

    Target Range

    Formula Cell

  • The Formula Cell is the “Workpaper Formula” cell



    Range Mapping

  • Select Send Data



    Range Mapping

  • Drag and copy the original Workpaper Formula cell to create mappings for the other cells/data items


    Range Mapping

  • Click Send Data




    Range Mapping



    Range Mapping

    Confidential and Proprietary

  • Map first cell in range using the cell reference




    Range Mapping

  • The Target Range is the cell to receive the data



    Range Mapping

  • Drag and copy the original formula cell to create mappings for the other data cells




    Mappings: What’s New




    46


    Range GETs

  • Use one Get formula, pull multiple data points using Leadsheets (i.e. Provision, Deferred, Payable)




    Perpetual Mappings

  • Until now, ONESOURCE Tax Provision only used specific point in time mapping. With perpetual mapping, you can design a formula that accounts for all classes and subclasses – including new/added items.


    Columnar Mappings Sets

  • Use one Set formula, push multiple data points. Payable data will be the first to experience mass sends.



    Storage and Management




    50

DP109B – ONESOURCE Workpapers Workshop

Monday, November 12

2:00 pm – 2:55 pm


1


Warren Jagger


Warren Jagger is currently an Associate Solution Consultant for ONESOURCE. He has been with Thomson Reuters for over 4 years and previously was on the Client Success team acting as an advocate for Provision only and Express RS only clients.

In his current role, Warren aims to educate current and prospective clients on ONESOURCE solutions with a focus on Provision.

Warren holds a Bachelor’s Degree in Applied Mathematics from The College of New Jersey and a Masters of Business Administration from Fairleigh Dickinson University.


Objectives

Upon completion, attendees will be able to demonstrate the key features, benefits, and navigational processes for the ONESOURCE Workpapers application.


Agenda slide


  • Introduction

  • Mappings: SET

  • Mappings: GET

  • Mappings: Range

  • Mappings: What’s New

  • Storage and Management


    Introduction




    5


    Data Management Tools

  • Prior to ONESOURCE Workpapers, clients could use various data management tools to either populate ONESOURCE applications with data and calculations or extract data and calculations from those applications

  • The goal of ONESOURCE Workpapers is to provide a single data management tool for use with all ONESOURCE applications

  • The two data management tools typically used by ONESOURCE Tax Provision users were Active Workpapers and Excel Add-in

  • These tools can continue to be utilized by clients who have not yet upgraded to v2016 Provision


    Data Management Tools

  • For clients who have upgraded to or are newly licensed users of v2016 Provision, ONESOURCE Workpapers replaces Active Workpapers

  • Excel Add-in (now called Data Import) can continue to be used with v2016 Provision. However, it is anticipated that for Provision users, ONESOURCE Workpapers will eventually replace Data Import


    Migration to Workpapers

  • When a v2014.1 client wants to upgrade to v2016, they contact the ONESOURCE Tax Provision Support Team. The Support team will provide guidance as to the process for migrating current Active Workpapers

  • All Active Workpapers in ONESOURCE Tax Provision will be migrated to ONESOURCE Workpapers

  • There is not an option to choose which active workpapers are migrated to the Workpapers application


    Workpapers Add-in

  • The Workpaper Add-in is an Excel add-in used to design and build Excel workpapers

  • The Add-in must be installed before using ONESOURCE Workpapers




    Workpapers Add-in

  • The Workpaper Add-in is an Excel add-in used to design and build Excel workpapers

  • The Add-in must be installed before using ONESOURCE Workpapers



    Registration and Association

  • Prior to using ONESOURCE Workpapers, it must be Registered with your Provision application / instance




    Registration and Association

  • Similarly, ONESOURCE Workpapers must be Associated with your Provision application / instance




    Mappings: SET




    13


    SET and GET

  • Mappings are formula driven definitions of the cells in a workpaper into which to post data and calculations retrieved from a ONESOURCE application or from which to send data and calculations to a ONESOURCE application

    • GET: Retrieve and post to a workpaper

    • SET: Send to a ONESOURCE application


      SET: Send to a ONESOURCE Application



      SET: Send to a ONESOURCE Application

  • Open the Field Browser to begin the mapping process

  • Select SET data

  • Select a ONESOURCE Application for linkage

  • Select Field to map


    SET: Send to a ONESOURCE Application

  • Drag and drop the Field name onto the workpaper next to the data to be SET

  • IMPORTANT: Your original workpaper will need to be modified to include these Workpaper Formula cells



    SET: Send to a ONESOURCE Application

  • The Formula cells can be located on the spreadsheet wherever your choose

  • However, it is recommended that when your spreadsheet has a range of items to be mapped that the Formula cells be in a column adjacent to the items to be mapped



    SET: Send to a ONESOURCE Application

  • The Function Wizard opens

    Confidential and Proprietary

  • Make the appropriate “Parameter” (Component) selections and click Next





    SET: Send to a ONESOURCE Application

    Target Range

    Formula Cell

  • Either enter the Target Range (cell) and Formula Cell



    SET: Send to a ONESOURCE Application

  • Use the Range Selection buttons to click the cells in the workpaper



    SET: Send to a ONESOURCE Application

  • The mapped cell will display a Ready to Push status

  • Click Send Data to SET/send the data to the application






    SET: Send to a ONESOURCE Application

  • After the data is SET/sent, the mapped cell will display a date and time stamp

  • However, the cell formula is not removed



    SET: Send to a ONESOURCE Application

  • An alternative to using the Field Browser to create SET (or GET) mappings is to use Functions



SET: Send to a ONESOURCE Application



Mappings: GET




26


GET: Retrieve from Provision and post to a Workpaper



GET: Retrieve from Provision and post to a Workpaper

  • Open the Field Browser to begin the mapping process

  • Select GET data

  • Select a ONESOURCE Application for linkage

  • Select Field to map



    GET: Retrieve from Provision and post to a Workpaper

  • Drag and drop the Field name onto the workpaper in the appropriate cell

  • Note: Unlike mappings with the SET function, a separate Formula cell for GET is not needed



    GET: Retrieve from Provision and post to a Workpaper

  • The Function Wizard opens

    Confidential and Proprietary

  • Make the appropriate selections and click Next





    GET: Retrieve from Provision and post to a Workpaper

  • Either enter the Target Range cell or click the Range selection button to click the cell in the workpaper

  • Click Done



    GET: Retrieve from Provision and post to a Workpaper

  • The mapped cell will be populated

  • If your workpaper has a formula in the Variance column, the GET function will trigger the variance calculation



    Mappings: Range




    33


    Range Mapping




    Confidential and Proprietary


    Range Mapping

    Confidential and Proprietary

  • Map the first cell in the range using the cell reference


    Range Mapping



    Range Mapping



    Range Mapping

  • The Target is the cell with the Perm Diff $$ amount

    Target Range

    Formula Cell

  • The Formula Cell is the “Workpaper Formula” cell



    Range Mapping

  • Select Send Data



    Range Mapping

  • Drag and copy the original Workpaper Formula cell to create mappings for the other cells/data items



    Range Mapping

  • Click Send Data




    Range Mapping



    Range Mapping

    Confidential and Proprietary

  • Map first cell in range using the cell reference




    Range Mapping

  • The Target Range is the cell to receive the data



    Range Mapping

  • Drag and copy the original formula cell to create mappings for the other data cells



    Mappings: What’s New




    46


    Range GETs

  • Use one Get formula, pull multiple data points using Leadsheets (i.e. Provision, Deferred, Payable)




    Perpetual Mappings

  • Until now, ONESOURCE Tax Provision only used specific point in time mapping. With perpetual mapping, you can design a formula that accounts for all classes and subclasses – including new/added items.


    Columnar Mappings Sets

  • Use one Set formula, push multiple data points. Payable data will be the first to experience mass sends.

DP110A – Tax Basis Balance Sheet and Income Statement

Monday, November 12 3:25PM – 4:20PM


1


Jill Tekampe


Jill is a Training Manager who has been focused on client training for Thomson Reuters since 2006.

She has been in the tax technology field for her entire career. Prior to joining Thomson Reuters, she was a Product Manager for Arthur Andersen Tax Technology Solutions and Vertex.

Jill holds a BA from Dickinson College and a Masters of Accounting from Nova Southeastern.


Objectives

Upon completion, attendees will be able to identify the steps and activities to create a tax basis balance sheet structure and the alternative methods for entering data for the accounts in the structure.


Agenda


  • Balance Sheet Structure

  • Account Balances

  • Adjustments

  • Cumulative Temporary Differences

  • Reporting

  • Tax Basis Income Statement

  • Workpapers


    Balance Sheet Structure




    5


    Process

    1. Create the Balance Sheet Structure

      - Create Lines (Rollups) and Sublines (Detail Rows / your accounts)

    2. Populate Trial Balance Data

    3. Make Adjustments to Trial Balance

    4. Map Cumulative Temporary Differences to Sublines

    5. Generate and Review Reports


    Process

  • Structure of the balance sheet (applicable lines and supporting detail) is setup

  • Accounts are then associated to structure



    Trial Balance Lines

  • Rollups that create summary structure of the balance sheet

  • Codes & names are user-defined

  • Best Practice – Create Lines for all applicable lines in Balance Sheet section of tax return



    Trial Balance Lines



    Trial Balance Sublines

  • Detail supporting Trial Balance Lines

  • Level to which accounts are assigned

    Confidential and Proprietary

  • Codes & names are user defined


    Trial Balance Sublines




    Trial Balance Sublines

  • Must the Sublines be your actual GL accounts? No

  • Should the Sublines be your actual GL accounts? Yes

  • Considerations regarding SubLine creation and maintenance:

    • Defined at the Administration level, not at the Unit level

    • Do all Units need the same Sublines (i.e. do you have a common chart)?

    • Any new Sublines?


      Trial Balance Lines and Sublines

      Confidential and Proprietary

  • Can be created and/or updated using the Import Categories spreadsheet


    Account Balances




    14


    G/L Bridge

  • Account balances can be bridged from a general ledger extract file

    – Bridge rules relate accounts to Sublines



    G/L Bridge


    G/L Bridge

  • Account balances can be bridged from a general ledger extract file

    – Option to Add Unmapped Sublines



    G/L Bridge

  • Account balances can be bridged from a general ledger extract file

    – Option to Add Unmapped Sublines



    Import

  • Account balances can be imported using the Numbers Import spreadsheet

    – Note that Subline is identified in Column B



    Manual

  • Account balances can be entered

    – Note that Code – Description is the Subline



    Adjustments




    21


    Adjustments

    Book, Reclass, Other

  • In addition to recording ending book balances, you can import or enter Book Adjustments, Tax Reclasses and Other Adjustments to those balances

    – Note that these adjustments cannot be bridged



    Confidential and Proprietary

    22


    Cumulative Temporary Differences




    23


    Tax Basis Mapping

  • Cumulative temporary differences

    – must also be accounted for in order

    to have a complete Tax Basis Balance Sheet or Income Statement presentation

  • recorded via Temporary Differences screens

  • additional information needed to identify presentation on Tax Basis Balance Sheet or Income Statement

    – accomplished via a mapping exercise


    Tax Basis Mapping - Example

  • Temp Diff Entry | T250 - Bad Debt Reserve




    Tax Basis Mapping - Example

  • Component Type drop-down contains types of differences

  • Difference drop-down contains differences

  • Debit and Credit drop-downs contains Trial Balance Sublines

  • Contra Account drop-down for Credit or Debit selection


    Tax Basis Mapping - Example



    Reporting




    28


    View Options

  • Summary vs. Detail

    • Summary shows Trial Balance Lines

    • Detail shows Trial Balance Sublines

  • Contracted vs. Expanded

    • Contracted shows the total amounts per activity

    • Expanded shows the temporary difference activity

  • Data Detail

    - Balances are tracked unit by unit, but reports are available on a separate company, consolidated or sub-consolidated basis

  • Currency

- Reports can be displayed in either Reporting or Local country currency


Confidential and Proprietary


Confidential and Proprietary

Trial Balance Sublines – Summary View







Tax Basis Income Statement




31


Tax Basis Income Statement


Process – Essentially the same as with the Tax Basis Balance Sheet

  1. Create Balance Sheet Structure

    - Create Lines (Rollups) and Sublines (Detail Rows / your accounts)

  2. Populate Trial Balance

  3. Make Adjustments to Trial Balance

  4. Map Cumulative Temporary Differences to Sublines

  5. Generate and Review Reports

    Range GETs

  • Use one Set formula, push multiple data points. Payable data will be the first to experience mass sends.

DP113A – Interim Functionality and Reporting

Tuesday, November 13

8:00 AM – 8:55 AM


1


Karin Burns


Karin Burns is currently a Senior Solution Consultant for ONESOURCE. She has been with Thomson Reuters for over 10 years, having held various roles on the services team and helping our global regions adopt new technology.

Prior to Thomson Reuters Karin spent a few years at KPMG in which she worked on Federal and State compliance for corporations, partnerships and individuals. In addition Karin spent a few years working internally in a tax department. In that role she prepared the provision, compliance, sales and use and property taxes and implemented TaxStream.

Karin has an undergraduate degree in Accounting and a Master of Taxation both from Arizona State University.


Objectives

Upon completion, attendees will be able to identify system setup requirements, data population choices, quarterly steps, and report generation choices within Tax Provision to compute a projected annual tax rate and determine the application of that rate to actual year-to-date pretax data.


Agenda slide


  • Overview

  • Provision System Process

  • Data Population – Forecast

  • Data Population – Actual

  • Reporting

  • Advance To Next Period


Overview




5


Overview


General Interim Reporting Process

  1. Calculate an Annualized Forecasted Effective Tax Rate.

  2. Apply the Annualized Forecasted Effective Tax Rate to the Actual Year-to-Date Pre- Tax Book Income.

  3. Add the tax effect for Extraordinary and Discrete Items.

  4. Post Journal entries to reflect amounts calculated in Steps 2-4.


Confidential and Proprietary

6


Provision System Process




7

Confidential and Proprietary


Forecast and Actual

  • Data entry and calculations are separated into two sub-datasets:

  • Forecast

    • Populate rate-driving items

    • Annualized Forecasted Effective Tax Rate is calculated

  • Actual

    • Populate actual PTBI and extraordinary/discrete items

    • Total Provision at interim period = Actual PTBI x Annualized Forecasted Effective Tax Rate + Discrete/Extraordinary Items


      Interim Dataset

  • When creating an Interim Dataset, you can choose either a 3-quarter isolated approach or a year-to-date approach that treats the data as growing each time period.


    Interim Dataset

  • With the isolated approach, a single time period’s Ending becomes the next time period’s Beginning when advancing to the next period.

  • If your time periods are Quarters, the Isolated method has Q1 as Jan 1 thru March 31. When Advancing to Q2 with the Isolated method, Q2 would be April 1 thru June 30.

  • With the year-to-date approach, the Beginning of a time period is a true Beginning for the entire dataset. Advancing to Q2 would result with the second quarter being year-to-date Jan 1 thru June 30.


    Interim Dataset

  • Additionally, you can select a time period Type: Quarters, Months or Periods.


    Interim Dataset

  • Then, you choose the # of periods (1-15) in the specific Type


    Interim Dataset

  • Example: If Quarters were chosen as the Period Type, you could then choose 1, 2, 3 or 4 as the # of periods

  • If Months were chosen as the Period Type, you could then choose 1, 2, 3, 4, etc., up to 12 # of periods.


    Interim Dataset

  • Depending on your interpretation of the interim process, use either the default Overal

    l Forecasted Effective Tax Rate or choose the Unit by Unit Forecasted Effective Tax Rate instead



    Interim Dataset

  • The rate basis choice determines how the computed Annualized Forecasted Tax Rate is applied to the Actual PTBI

  • The Overall rate basis will apply the consolidated forecasted rate to all of the units

  • The Unit by Unit rate basis will apply each unit's component of the overall forecasted rate to the unit.




    Interim Dataset

  • When choosing the Unit by Unit basis, a True-Up Unit must be selected for any true-up that is required to make up the difference between applying the Unit by Unit Forecasted Rate and the Overall Forecasted Rate to the Actual PTBI.


    Interim Dataset

  • Best Option for First Time Creation?




    Interim Dataset

  • For first-time setup and/or for any time period data population, data can be imported using Forecast and Actual import templates

  • Create an import template by Exporting the selected sub-dataset



    Interim Dataset

  • Enter the data into the appropriate tabs of the spreadsheet



    Interim Dataset

  • Save the spreadsheet and import into the applicable sub-dataset



    Data Population - Forecast




    23


  • Forecasted Annual PTBI

    • Units to be considered in the rate

    • Inclusion / Exclusion of Foreign Losses

    • Exclusion of Other Units

  • Forecasted Annual Rate Drivers

    • Permanent Differences

    • Temporary Difference Deferred Only Activity (if needed)

    • Tax Adjustments

  • Rates & Apportionment Factors

    • Domestic & Foreign Statutory Tax Rate

    • States Tax Rates

    • State Apportionment Factors


  • Import or Enter



    Pre-Tax Book Income

  • Estimated Pre-Tax Book Income

    • Annualized amount or

    • Quarterly amounts


      Tax Rates

  • Tax Rates expected to be enacted by the end of the year should be populated for each unit




    Exclusions

  • Exclude Foreign Loss: The system will exclude the unit from the interim provision calculations only if the Pre-Tax Book Income is negative

  • Exclude Unit: The system will exclude the unit from the interim provision calculations regardless of positive or negative PTBI



    Permanent Differences



    Temporary Differences



    State Data

  • State Details

    • Tax Rates

    • Apportionment Factors

    • Federal Deductibility Rules

  • Projected State Rate Drivers

  • Amounts that impact the overall Forecasted Effective Rate:

    • State Permanent Differences

    • State Temporary Differences, After Apportionment Temporary Differences and After Tax Temporary Differences (deferred only activity, if needed)

    • State Tax Adjustments


State Data


State Data



Data Population - Actual




34


  • Year to Date Pre-Tax Book Income

  • Rate Drivers

    • Permanent Differences

    • Temporary Differences

    • Tax Adjustments

  • Rates & Apportionment Factors

    • Domestic & Foreign Statutory Tax Rate

    • States Tax Rates

    • State Apportionment Factors

  • Discrete / Extraordinary Items

  • Payable Information


    Bridge or Import or Enter


    G/L Bridge

  • Functionality is for Actual Sub-Dataset only



    Quarterly Pre-Tax Book Income




    Rates

  • Unit Tax Rates are applied to all items in the Actual sub-dataset except PTBI

  • Interim Rate is applied to PTBI



    Discrete / Extraordinary Items




    Discrete / Extraordinary Items

  • Must first exist in or be added to the database



    Discrete / Extraordinary Items




    Reporting




    43


    Key Reports

  • Forecast Rate

    • Components that generate the rate:

      • Forecasted Worldwide PTBI, Excluded Units, and Rate-Driving Items

      • Breakdown of the rate by Domestic, Foreign, and State

      • Quarter-by-Quarter Rate Variance

    • Overall vs Unit-by-Unit breakdown of the rate

  • Interim Provision

    • Pre-Tax Book Income

      • Application of the Forecasted Rate to the Actual PTBI

    • Discrete / Extraordinary Items


    Key Reports

  • Forecast True-Up Rate (Consolidated)

    – Explains the computation of the true-up required to make up the difference between applying the

    Unit-by-Unit Forecasted Rate and the Overall Forecasted Rate to the Actual PTBI


    Advance To Next Period




    46


    Process

  • The first period must be Advanced to the second period before any data can be entered in the second period

  • Similarly, the second period must be Advanced before data can be entered for the third period


    Process

  • When the period is Advances:

    • Forecast data in the prior period will be copied into the next period

    • Actual ending rates and balances will roll forward from the prior period to the next period

    • Data entry fields for the next period are opened

  • Prior periods will be locked

    – Data entry screens and reports can be reviewed, but no edits or entries can be made


    Rollback

  • If a prior period was Advanced in error and needs to be adjusted, there is the option to Roll Back to the prior period.



Thank You

Three Payable Categories

  • Three Payable category items are configured via Manage Payable section of Administration:

    • Transaction Types

    • Rollups

    • Buckets


Payable Transaction (Txn) Types

  • The transaction type is assigned when the data is entered



Payable Transaction (Txn) Types



Payable Transaction (Txn) Types

System is pre-populated with many transaction types

  • Descriptions but not codes can be modified

  • Associated rollup category can be changed

  • Additional transaction types can be added

    Four system-populated transaction types:

  • CPROV

  • RTP

  • ATR

  • OTHER

    • Used for automatic posting from the provision to the payable

    • Can be used to post to a prior year layer in the payable

      • For example, the system specifically looks for RTP and ATR in the codes for posting between years

    Parameters



    Non-Cash Adjustments



    Non-Cash Adjustments

  • The Auto-Posting mechanism will incorporate RTP adjustments as well as other prior year adjustments

  • The provision system looks for specific codes in order to post to a prior year layer in the payable.



    Non-Cash Adjustments

  • Adjustment codes must begin with NC_ for the system to recognize the amounts as includable in the non-cash payable entry



    Payable Postings: User Choices




    38


    Data Entry Restriction

    Limitation on the dates to enter for transactions

  • For example, if the dataset is created as a 2018 Full Year Dataset, the tax provision system will only allow a user to enter payable transactions with a date of calendar year 2017 or 2019

    If you wish to not limit the date range for transaction data entry, a parameter can be deactivated to allow users to input, or import, data only within the year of the dataset

  • Accomplished in Manage Configurations


Confidential and Proprietary


Confidential and Proprietary

Data Entry Restriction

Financial Reporting Effects of the Tax Cuts and Jobs Act

November 12, 2018


1


  • Pilar Garcia is the Managing Editor of Catalyst: US GAAP. She is a Certified Public Accountant in New York and New Jersey.

  • Prior to joining Thomson Reuters, Ms. Garcia was a senior manager at PricewaterhouseCoopers with 14 years of auditing experience. She also worked in PwC’s national office, consulting on various financial reporting topics and SEC matters. At Thomson Reuters, she has presented the new US GAAP models for revenue recognition and leases, and written about the new expected credit loss model for financial instruments, among other accounting developments.

  • Ms. Garcia is a graduate of Rutgers Business School and the Newark College of Arts and Sciences.


    • Nick Guarro joined Thomson Reuters in 2017. He is currently a Solution Consultant for the ONESOURCE suite at Thomson Reuters Tax & Accounting, a division of Thomson Reuters, Inc. In this role his responsibilities include helping both prospective and current clients understand the value and capabilities of the ONESOURCE suite.

    • Nick has 17 years of corporate tax and tax technology experience. He served as a implementation lead for a Fortune 500 company where he assisted in implementing the ONESOURCE suite. He brings an extensive broad knowledge base around all suites of Thomson Reuters Direct Tax and Transfer Pricing products.

    • Nick has a B.S. in Accounting from Drexel University.

FASB ASC 740, Income Taxes




6

Primary objectives of FASB ASC 740


Objective 1

Record taxes payable (or refundable) for the current year


Objective 2

Record deferred taxes for the future tax consequences of events recognized in the entity’s financial statements or tax returns


Reflect current and future tax effects of all income-related events Financial statements or tax returns

Basic recognition and measurement principles

Basic recognition and measurement principles—Deferred tax provision


The balance sheet approach or the “asset and liability method”

  • Deferred taxes ending balance (financial balance sheet)

    • Identify temporary differences and when each difference is expected to reverse

    • Apply the applicable enacted tax rates and laws expected to be in effect

    • As a general rule, record deferred taxes for all temporary differences and carryforwards

    • Assess the need for a valuation allowance on deferred tax assets


  • Deferred tax provision (financial income statement)

    • Change in the deferred tax balances from the beginning of the year to the end of the year


      Limited exceptions when deferred taxes are not recorded

      Basic recognition and measurement principles—Deferred tax provision—Limited exceptions


      Investments in foreign subsidiaries


      Undistributed earnings of domestic subsidiaries


      Do not recognize deferred tax liability unless it becomes clear that the temporary difference will reverse in the foreseeable future

      Basic recognition and measurement principles—Valuation allowance


  • Evidence from one or more of the four sources of taxable income


  • Cumulative losses in recent years represent strong negative evidence


  • To overcome the presumption that a full or partial valuation allowance is not necessary, positive evidence must outweigh negative evidence


  • Assign weight based on the extent to which evidence can be objectively verified


    Whether and when to record a valuation allowance Consider all available evidence—positive and negative

    Two-step process for reporting of a tax position on the financial statements


  • To recognize an individual tax position

    • Must meet the more-likely-than-not threshold based on technical merits

    • Recognize a deferred tax asset (before valuation allowance) or liability for uncertain tax position


  • To measure the tax position for financial reporting purposes

    • Record the largest amount of tax benefit that is more-likely-than-not realizable upon settlement

    • Valuation allowance on deferred tax asset


  • To recognize a previously unrecognized tax position in a subsequent period

    • New information that was not available in a prior period


      Conclude it is more likely than not that the tax position will be upheld upon examination by the relevant tax authority


  • Consider both of the following

    • All possible tax settlement amounts

    • Associated probabilities of achieving those amounts if challenged by tax regulator


  • Determine probabilities by considering all facts, circumstances, and relevant information

    • Information available at the “reporting date” (most recent balance sheet date)

    • Assume tax regulator has complete information about the position


Record the highest amount of tax benefits that is more than 50-percent likely to be achieved if challenged



Step 1

List possible outcomes in descending order

Step 2

Assign a probability to each outcome

Step 3

Calculate cumulative probability and Identify outcomes > 50% of occurrence

Step 4

Select largest possible outcome with > 50% occurrence

5%

5% + 0% =

5%

25% + 5% =

30%

Record the highest amount of tax benefits that is more than 50-percent likely to be achieved if challenged


Accounting for the Tax Cuts and Jobs Act




15

Changes for corporate entities


%

Corporate Tax Rates

TAX

AMT

Lowered corporate tax rates to a flat rate of 21%


AMT

Repealed the alternative minimum tax (AMT) for corporations

NOLs

Changed limits on net operating losses (NOLs)

Expensing

Revised rules on expensing, generally to limit deductions for tax purposes

BEAT

Introduced a new base erosion and anti-abuse tax (BEAT) to prevent the avoidance of tax through payments to foreign affiliates


50


50

Foreign Earnings

Imposed a one-time transition tax on

undistributed and previously- untaxed, post-1986 foreign earnings

GILTI

Required a US shareholder to include

global intangible low-taxed income (GILTI) in Subpart F income

Authoritative guidance in FASB ASC 740 > Changes in Tax Laws or Rates



Subsequent Measurement

Deferred tax liabilities and assets shall be adjusted for the effect of a change in tax laws or rates. A change in tax laws or rates may also require a reevaluation of a valuation allowance for deferred tax assets. [FASB ASC 740-10-35-4]

Presentation

When deferred tax accounts are adjusted as required by paragraph 740-10-35-4 for the effect of a change in tax laws or rates, the effect shall be included in income from continuing operations for the period that includes the enactment date. [FASB ASC 740-10-45-15]

SEC “SAB No. 118” FASB ASU “Stranded Tax Effects” FASB Staff “Q&A documents”

Regulatory response—SEC interpretive guidance “SAB No. 118”


  • Finalize accounting for the TCJA within one-year measurement window

    • Date entity completes its accounting under Topic 740 to record the effects of the TCJA; or

    • One year after the enactment date of the TCJA


  • Report provisional amounts if accounting is incomplete (reasonable estimates only)

    • Apply law in effect immediately prior to TCJA (when a reasonable estimate is not possible)


  • Provide detailed disclosures of provisional amounts and incomplete areas of accounting

    • Measurement period adjustments recorded during the reporting period

    • Areas for which the entity has not completed its accounting under Topic 740

    • Reasons why the accounting is not complete


  • Update disclosures until accounting is complete or measurement period is closed

    Regulatory response—FASB ASU No. 2018-02 “Stranded Tax Effects”


  • Accounting policy election

    • Optional election to reclassify amounts arising from the TCJA from AOCI to retained earnings

    • Compute effects of applying the newly enacted corporate tax rate

    • Take difference between tax effects of new rate and balances at historical tax rate that remain in AOCI

    • Reclassify calculated amount from AOCI to retained earnings


  • Change in accounting principle

    • Required disclosures


  • Applies only to the TCJA enactment

    • Cannot be applied to any other tax reform or future legislation


  • Ongoing disclosure requirements

– Significant accounting policies

Regulatory response—FASB Staff “Q&A documents”


FASB Staff “Q&A documents”


Topic 740, No. 1, Whether Private Companies and Not-for-Profit Entities Can Apply SAB 118


Topic 740, No. 2, Whether to Discount the Tax Liability on the Deemed Repatriation


Topic 740, No. 3, Whether to Discount Alternative Minimum Tax Credits that Become Refundable


Topic 740, No. 4, Accounting for the Base Erosion Anti-Abuse Tax


Topic 740, No. 5, Accounting for Global Intangible Low-Taxed Income


The TCJA beyond FASB ASC 740 Other financial reporting areas



21


  • Fair value measurements


  • Investments in qualified affordable housing projects


  • Goodwill impairment testing


  • Incomplete accounting for a business combination


  • Hedging of foreign currency risk


  • Accounting for share-based compensation


  • Fair value measurements

    • Immediate effects on a company’s net assets and long-term forecasts

    • Influence on long-term business and operating decisions

    • Valuation models that use an income approach


  • Investments in qualified affordable housing projects

    • Reduced corporate tax rates may have an adverse effect on the expected yield

    • Lower enacted tax rates on existing LIHTC projects may result in lower value of deductible tax losses

    • Reduced value of deductible tax losses, in turn, may drive down the pricing for future LIHTC projects


  • Goodwill impairment testing

    • Remeasurement of an entity’s deferred tax balances

    • Significant shifts in the carrying value of a reporting unit

    • Potential triggering event for an interim test of goodwill impairment


  • Incomplete accounting for a business combination

    • Open measurement period

    • Changes in tax rates affect acquirer’s measurement of deferred tax balances (acquisition method)

    • TCJA effects are adjustments to current earnings (part of current income tax expense, not goodwill)

    • TCJA effects are not measurement period adjustments (new information, e.g., new applicable rates, occurred after acquisition date)


  • Hedging of foreign currency risk

    • Potential reassessment of hedge effectiveness

    • May have to discontinue hedge accounting based on the probability of a forecasted transaction


  • Accounting for share-based compensation

    • Changes to the deductibility of performance-based compensation under Code Sec. 162(m)

    • Changes affect executive compensation and may result in significant new temporary differences

    • Broader definition of “covered employees”

      • Compensation paid to CEO, CFO, and three other highest-paid officers are subject to $1 million deduction limit

    • Eliminates exclusion for “performance-based compensation” from the $1 million deduction limit

    • Expands the definition of publicly-held corporation that are subject to the deduction limit


Thank You

Deferred Balances Workpaper



Rollups




30


Definition

  • Rollups are user-defined groupings that allow detail (e.g., temp differences) to be rolled up to a higher level for reporting purposes.

  • One rollup may assist in generating footnotes while another rollup may explain specific results contained in management reports.

  • There are 3 types of rollups:

    • Deferred Rollup: Contains Temp differences

    • Effective Rate Rollup: Contains all items in the Deferred Rollups plus Perms and Tax Adjustments

    • Trial Balance Rollup: Contains trial balance sub-lines


Process

Create Component Rollup Sets Examples:

Footnote Disclosure or 2018 Management Report

  1. Create rollup categories (Rollups) Sometimes referred to as rollup buckets Examples:

    Prepaid Expenses, Reserves

  2. Associate items with rollup categories


Process




Views

Confidential and Proprietary

The summary view of the Deferred Balances Report with the Rollup selected displays the rollup categories with summarized amounts for each category





Views

The hybrid view of the Deferred Balances Report with the Rollup selected displays the rollup category with the supporting detail of the temp differences included in each category



Views

The hybrid view of the Deferred Balances Report with the rollup selected



“Unassigned” Temp Differences? Consider an “Other” rollup category

Overview: ONESOURCE Tax Provision v2016




5


v2016 Significant Features

  • Removal of Citrix Layer – Zero client footprint

  • Support for multiple browsers and tablet-friendly

  • One click to go to Tax Provision’s homepage (Orange Application tiles)

  • One click to go to the last visited page in Tax Provision’s new Review and Edit area (White Recent Work tiles)

  • Review data from consolidated amounts to the lowest level detail in 2 clicks

  • New Data Entry grids that allow data entry and review of multiple datasets, units and jurisdictions

  • Most importantly, the underlying calculation and reporting functionality has not changed. v2016 simply provides a more efficient process for navigating thorough the application.

Bridge Trial Balance

  • The Trial Balance Bridge allows you to import a trial balance into ONESOURCE and, from there, automate the calculation of

    • Pre-tax Book Income

    • Permanent Difference

    • Temporary Diffeneces

  • Imported trial balances can also be used to

    • Compute the FX rate used for the system

    • Import in trial balance sublines (for use in tax basis balance sheets or workpapers)

    • Import in tax accounts for use in computing the journal entry


      Bridge Trial Balance

  • Trial Balance Automation is administered in the Administration / Manage Bridge section




    Bridge Trial Balance

  • Trial Balances are imported at the dataset level




    Bridge Trial Balance

    Confidential and Proprietary

  • Every time a trial balance is bridged you have the option to select which components to automate


    Bridge Trial Balance

  • Individual units’ trial balances, or a consolidated trial balance, can be imported




    Bridge Trial Balance

  • Files can be taken from a users hard drive in one of several specified formats, or imported via General Ledger Manager


    Bridge Trial Balance

  • The results of the import can be previewed prior to submission



Prepare a State Provision




47


Apportionment Rates

  • After states have been activated, state data entry and other functions are then available



    Blended States

  • Many companies calculate a Blended State rate outside of the system and use this rate as the statutory rate

  • In this case, the Apportionment % would be 100% and the tax rate would be the calculated blended rate.


    Mass Update Rates

  • Mass Update Rates are Maintained in Administration, Manage States



    State by State Perms and Temps

  • Set Federal Perms and Temps to be used on a state-by-state percentage basis

  • These settings can be entered as a template in Administration and copied to Datasets, or entered Dataset by Dataset



    State Usage of Federal Perms and Temps

  • Use a Federal perm to modify and amount for a specific State




    State NOLs

  • The NOL will be input by the system on the State After App Temp Difference Screen

  • The system will post a reclass to create the NOL Temporary difference when the unit has a taxable loss or will draw down an available NOL Temporary Difference when the unit has taxable income


    Jobs




    54


    Overview

  • Jobs is a repository of your prior and current imports and exports. Jobs details the status of imports and exports and provides access to the import and export logs. It also enables the user to download a pivot-table ready Excel spreadsheet for data exported files

  • A significant feature of the Jobs functionality is that imports and exports are processed as asynchronous tasks, meaning the user can continue to work in the application while the imports and exports are being processed


    Overview

  • Spreadsheet Imports


    Overview

  • Provision Lead Sheet Export

    • When exporting a Lead Sheet, such as the Provision Lead Sheet, the system generates a 2-tab pivot table file


      Overview

  • Provision Lead Sheet Export

    • The first tab is named Calculated Data. The second tab is namedTotal Tax Provision, as in this example:



ONESOURCE Workpapers




59


Overview

  • ONESOURCE Workpapers is a two pronged functionality.

    • Platform level/web-based repository for workpapers providing control, transparency, and organization

    • ONESOURCE and Excel integration point allowing the ability to push and pull data to and from applications

  • ONESOURCE Workpapers and ONESOURCE Tax Provision Usage Examples:

    • Singular cell push and pulls: adjustments, system codes, and calculated values

    • Range GETs/table extracts from ONESOURCE Tax Provision

    • ONESOURCE integration: Income Tax, General Ledger Manager, Transfer Pricing, etc.


      Texas Gross Margin

  • Singular Cell Pull & ONESOURCE Integration

    Provision Leadsheet

  • Range GETS: One Mapping, Multiple Data Points



For more Workpapers insights, please join our ONESOURCE Workpaper Synergy Sessions


Thank You

DP120A – Return to Provision True Up

Wednesday, November 14 1:05PM - 2:00PM


1


Jill Tekampe


  • Jill is a Training Manager who has been focused on client training for Thomson Reuters since 2006.

  • She has been in the tax technology field for her entire career. Prior to joining Thomson Reuters, she was a Product Manager for Arthur Andersen Tax Technology Solutions and Vertex.

  • Jill holds a BA from Dickinson College and a Masters of Accounting from Nova Southeastern.


    Confidential and Proprietary


    Objectives

    Upon completion, attendees will be able to identify the steps required for the system to calculate and post true-up amounts in the current provision dataset.


    Agenda


  • Overview

  • Setup

  • Results

  • RTP Example

  • RTP States


    Confidential and Proprietary


    Overview




    5


    Process

  • Tax provision for the prior year is typically booked in January of the current year

  • Tax return for the prior year is not finalized until October of the current year

  • Any differences between the return and provision in the prior year are trued-up in the third or fourth quarter of the current year

  • True-up items can affect the current and deferred provision as well as the ending deferred balances and ending income tax payable


    Process

    To accurately reflect the current period provision calculation, the prior period Return to Provision results must be booked in ONESOURCE Tax Provision.

    The following information is needed:

  • Difference in perm items (PTBI & M&E)

  • Total effect on current expense

  • Adjustments for deferreds


    Process

  • Identify / create required datasets

  • Create relationships between datasets

  • Populate tax return dataset

  • Review comparison report

  • Execute Post Return to Provision functionality

  • Confirm true up postings to current year dataset


    Setup




    9


  • The Return to Provision methodology compares a Prior Year Provision dataset to a dataset for the same year that contains tax return data

  • This comparison identifies the necessary true-up items

  • The true-up items are then posted to the Current Year Provision dataset


Three (3) Datasets are needed

  • Prior Year Provision Dataset

    • Rolled over from the year prior to that

  • Prior Year Return Dataset

    • Copied from the Previous Period Provision dataset

    • Modified to reflect tax return data

  • Current Year Provision Dataset

    • Rolled over from the Prior Period Provision dataset


Prior Year Return Dataset

  • Best Practice

    • Create by copying Previous Period Provision dataset

      • Control the data that is copied as desired

    • Modify to reflect tax return data

      • Can move data from ONESOURCE Income Tax

Three (3) Datasets are needed


Dataset Relations

  • Dataset Relations associates / links the 3 datasets needed for the identification of the true-up items and the posting

  • Prior Year Return dataset must be related to the Prior Year Provision dataset

  • Prior Year Return dataset must be related to the Current Year Provision dataset


    Dataset Relations

  • Edit the Prior Year Return dataset in order to create the dataset relations



    Manage Configurations

  • Unless default selection of No is or has been modified, only amounts populated in Current Activity field for temporary differences are considered when comparing data during the Return to Provision process

    ‐ That is, amounts in Balance Sheet Only and Deferred Only fields are ignored




    Results




    16


    True-Up Adjustments

  • True-up adjustments will be posted in the current provision as Non-Cash adjustments

  • Posting the adjustments as non-cash will preserve the correct, current cash provision calculation

  • Definition: The Cash provision (return basis provision) is the amount of current tax liability that is expected to be represented on the tax return.

  • Definition: The Non-Cash provision is any current taxes that should be accrued for prior years or for amounts that are not represented on the tax return.



True-Up Adjustments Naming Conventions

NC_RTP_year_PERM & NC_RTP_year_TEMP


When you select to post the true-up, these true-up adjustments will be:

  • Created by the system in Administration

  • Populated as Tax Adjustments in the Current Period Provision dataset

  • Reflected on the Tax Provision Report for the Current Period Provision



    When you select to post the true-up, the system will also:

  • True-up deferred items




    When you select to post the true-up, the system will also:

  • True-up the Payable

Confidential and Proprietary

– By virtue of the NC_ coding automatically used for the RTP true-up adjustments, the total amount of the true up automatically flows to Payables

    Code

    Example

    RTP Calculation

    NC_RTP_xxxx_Perm

    PTBI, Tax Adjustments and Perms

    Equals (1) the difference between Financial Taxable Income (FTI) in the Prior Year Provision dataset compared to Prior Year Return dataset multiplied by the Federal tax rate (2) plus Tax Adjustments. (FTI consists of PTBI, Deductible State Tax & Perm Diffs)

    NC_RTP_xxxx_Temp

    Temp Diff Activity, NOL

    Equals (1) the difference between Temp Diff Activity and


    Temp Diff Activity, and

    (2) NOL Activity in the Prior Year Provision dataset


    After-Tax Temp Diff

    compared to Prior Year Return dataset multiplied by the


    Activity

    Federal tax rate (3) plus After-Tax Temp Diff Activity.

    Confidential and Proprietary

  • The entries are posted to the current year dataset

RTP States




33


Overview

Setup and execution are the same as for federal

  • except the state portion of RTP functionality must be activated



    Overview

    • Results mirror federal

    • However, state rates and apportionment factors can be different between the beginning and end of a year, which adds a dimension to state RTP processing that should be addressed separately outside of this training

  • When you select to post the true-up, the system will also:

  • True-up the Payable

    • By virtue of the NC_ coding automatically used for the RTP true-up adjustments, the total amount of the true up automatically flows to Payables

    Confidential and Proprietary

    26


    Code

    Example

    RTP Calculation

    NC_RTP_xxxx_Perm

    PTBI, Tax

    Adjustments and Perms

    Equals (1) the difference between Financial Taxable Income (FTI) in the Prior Year Provision dataset compared to Prior Year Return dataset multiplied by the Federal tax rate (2) plus Tax Adjustments. (FTI consists of PTBI, Deductible State Tax & Perm Diffs)

    NC_RTP_xxxx_Temp

    Temp Diff Activity, NOL Temp Diff Activity, and After‐ Tax Temp Diff Activity

    Equals (1) the difference between Temp Diff Activity and (2) NOL Activity in the Prior Year Provision dataset compared to Prior Year Return dataset multiplied by the Federal tax rate (3) plus After‐Tax Temp Diff Activity.

Rob Wilson November 13, 2018

Rob Wilson


  • Rob joined Thomson Reuters in January 2008 as part of the TaxStream Acquisition. As a Senior Manager on the Services Team, his duties include implementing both the provision and UTP applications. He currently has more than 70 clients and acts as the lead on all UTP implementations.

  • Prior to joining Thomson Reuters, Rob worked eight years in the Tax Management Solutions (TMS) group at KPMG where he was a Tax Manager. After graduating college, he spent several years at the IRS in various capacities.

  • Rob has a BA in Political Science from Stony Brook University. He also has an MS in Accounting from C.W. Post.



Confidential and Proprietary

    Once you click on the Uncertain Tax Positions link on the Online home screen, you will be brought into the UTP application.



    • The Menu

      Navigator Bar

      Menu

    • The main Navigation Bar will bring you to the different areas of the UTP application.



      After first entering the UTP application, you will need to select the unit and the dataset that you wish to work with

  • Click the Settings tab on the Navigation Bar and the following box will display

    Save

  • Your selections will display in the upper right hand corner of the screen along with the year of the dataset

    9

  • The My UTP section of the application provides you with important news and updates as well as quick links and guides for some of the application’s functionality.

  • Check here regularly for release notes, scheduled outages and other information.

  • Import – import your items into the UTP application

    Navigating ONESOURCE Uncertain Tax Positions Positions Tab



    26


  • Click Positions on the Navigation Bar

  • This is where positions can be added or modified

  • There are two drop-down menus to perform certain tasks

  • The Action Menu and the Main Contingency Menu


    Main Contingency Menu

  • Add New Position – Manual entry of a new position

  • Reload Contingencies – Refreshes the Item Inventory

  • Batch Print – Print several reports at one time

  • Import – Imports positions in a dataset using the Excel template

  • Export – Exports positions in a dataset using the Excel template


    Entering a New Position

  • Select type of position

    • Permanent Difference

    • Temporary Difference

    • Tax Adjustment


    Entering a New Position

  • Identify the Issue

    – Year, jurisdiction, etc.


    Entering a New Position

  • Issue Details - As Filed

    • The Amount in Question is the amount identified as potentially being subject to audit.

    • If the amount, as it would impact the provision, reduces taxable income then it should be entered as a negative

    • Enter rates; click Next


    Entering a New Position

  • The Amount Sustained Current is pre-populated in eight scenarios but can be edited as needed

  • Enter probability percentages (must add up to 100%)




    Entering a New Position

  • Amount Expected to be Sustained

    • Brings forward the apportionment (when relevant), state tax rate (when relevant) and federal tax rate (for state positions)

      • These fields are editable


    Entering a New Position

  • Interest & Penalties

    • Can be hardcoded or calculated

    • Fed and State rates can be entered to account for the benefit on the interest


      Entering a New Position Interest & Penalties Calculators

    • Specify interest start dates and end dates

    • Overpayment Underpayment rate

    • Option to calculate Hot Interest


    Defined Jurisdiction Custom Jurisdiction Entered Jurisdiction


    Entering a New Position

  • Hot Interest

    – For large Corporate Underpayments

  • Penalty Calculation

    – Enter penalty rate

  • Penalty 6662 and 6651 available for Fed positions


    Managing Positions

  • Modifying an Item

    • After a position is added or rolled over from a prior period, it can be modified.

    • The type of modification will determine if the issue is final and should not be rolled to the subsequent period.


    Managing Positions

  • Modifying an Item

    • Non-Final Modifications

      • Change in Judgment (CIJ)

      • Change in Interest (CII)

      • Return to Provision (RTP)

      • Settlement – Partial (SET-NF)

    • Final Modifications

      • No Longer Uncertain (NLU)

      • Expiration of Statute (EXP)

      • Settlement – Final (SET-F)


    Managing Positions

  • Sorting

    • The contingencies table can be sorted by any column by clicking on the title of the column

    • Can sort by multiple columns, the order of application is determined starting at the left





    Managing Positions

  • Filtering

    • Contingencies table can be filtered based on the nine different columns

      Filter

    • Begin typing the name of the column desired and the options are auto populated with the results




    Managing Positions

  • Reordering the Columns

    – The columns in the contingencies table can be reordered by clicking and dragging to desired location



    Managing Positions

  • Grid Tools

    • Highlight Expiring Positions

    • Allows users to group items by

      • Component

      • Jurisdiction

      • Year

      • Status


    Action menu

  • Provides the ability to perform the same action on multiple positions simultaneously

    • Remove

    • Mark as NLU (No Longer Uncertain)

    • Add Notes / Attachments

    • Update Interest End Dates

    • Recalculate Interest

    • Print Batch Schedules

    • Expired Due to Statute

    • Update Cumulative Historic CTA


    Navigating ONESOURCE Uncertain Tax Positions Settlements (Full & Partial)



    44


    Modifying an Item

  • Once a position is added or rolled over from a prior period, it can be modified multiple ways.

  • The type of modification will determine if the issue is final and should not be rolled to the subsequent period.


    Non-Final

    • Edit as New (only New)

    • Change in Judgment

    • Change in Interest

    • Return to Provision

    • Settlement - Partial

    Final

    • Remove (only New)

    • Settlement – Final

    • No Longer Uncertain

    • Expiration of Statute


    Settlements

  • To settle a position, select Modify | Enter a Settlement from the Item Menu and then choose Final or Non-Final



    The Current Outlook column is pre-populated and not editable


    Populate the Settlement Outlook column

    • Enter the amount of Tax settled with the taxing authority

    • Enter the Gross Interest paid

      – Three pieces of benefit are calculated for you, but can be modified

    • Enter the Penalties that were paid

    • Note: Grayed out cells are not editable!


      The NLU column is the calculated non-settled amounts, based on the entries in the Settlement Outlook column

  • This amount will run through the P&L


    If you click Save without filling in any fields in the Settlement Outlook column

  • All the amounts will be marked as NLU (Not Settled)

  • A warning will pop up if this is the case


    The Settlement column/row on reports will populate with information from the

    Settlement Outlook column

    The Change columns/rows on reports will populate with information from the NLU column Ending Balance on reports will be zero



    The Current Outlook column is pre-populated and not editable

  • Populate the Settlement Outlook and Remaining Balance columns

    • Enter the amount of Tax settled with the taxing authority and the amount which should remain uncertain

    • Enter the Interest paid and the amount which should remain uncertain

      – 3 pieces of benefit are calculated for you, but can be modified

    • Enter the penalties that were paid

    • Note: Grayed out cells are not editable!


      The NLU column is the calculated non-settled amounts based on your entries in the

      Settlement Outlook and Remaining Balance columns

      If you click Save without filling in any fields in the Settlement Outlook or

      Remaining Balance columns

  • All the amounts will be marked as NLU (not Settled or as the Ending Balance)

– A warning will pop up if this is the case


The Settlement column/row on reports will populate with information from the Settlement Outlook

column

The Change columns/rows on reports will populate with information from the NLU column

The Ending Balance column/row on reports will populate with information from the Remaining Balance column



Navigating ONESOURCE Uncertain Tax Positions Labels & Label Groups



53


  • UTPs with similar characteristics can be grouped together for reporting purposes by using labels

  • Positions can have multiple labels assigned to them for different reporting options


    Adding a Label

  • Labels can be assigned three different ways

    1. By clicking on the blue/gray symbol next to an item’s name

    2. By using the Action Menu in the Uncertain Positions tab and selecting Assign Labels

      – Used for attaching labels en masse by unit

    3. By creating and assigning labels in the Admin Center under Labels & Groups


      Method 1

  • Click on the gray label directly to the left of the position in the Positions tab

  • A box will display, allowing the user to create a new label or assign an already existing label



    After a label is selected, it will highlight in blue

  • When unselected, the blue highlight will go away

  • Multiple labels can be assigned to one position by holding down the Ctrl key and clicking on the label names

  • After selecting a label, Click Submit Label Assignment


    Method 2

  • Check the box of the positions that you want to add a label to

  • Select Assign Labels from the Action Menu on the left side of the application

  • Click Go



    Method 3

  • Under the Admin tab, select Labels & Groups

  • Select Labels from the drop-down menu

  • Click Add


  • A new line will be created

    • Type in the label name

    • Click Save


    Label Groups

  • A Label Group works like a sub-consolidation of labels

  • It allows the user to group positions in the reports by multiple different criteria

  • Label groups are created in the same manner as labels

    – Method 3

  • After creation, any label can be assigned to a label group

  • There is no limit to the amount of labels a group can include

  • Label Groups can consist of other label groups


    Assignments

  • To assign labels to label groups

    • Select Assignments from the drop-down menu

    • Hold down the Ctrl key and click on the labels to be included

      • Selected labels will highlight in blue

    • Click Save



    Navigating ONESOURCE Uncertain Tax Positions Reporting & Annual Disclosures



    62


    In the Reporting Tab:

  • Select which of the 14 main reports you would like to view


  • Select the view options from the drop-down menus


  • Click Get Report


    Reports

  • The Reporting tab allows the user to run reports that will only display positions tagged with a specific label or label group



    Reports

  • The group by feature allows the user to sort positions on the reports by several criteria, including labels


After selecting a report, select which jurisdiction you wish to include on the report


  • Federal + All States

  • Federal Only

  • All States Only

  • State Specific

  • Select Gross/Benefit Option

    • Gross

    • Benefit

    • Net of Benefit

  • Select Currency

    • Reporting or Local


Select the Unit or SubConsolidation to include on the report

  • To include all units, you must create a ‘Consolidated’ SubConsolidation

  • User must have rights to the SubConsolidation in order to run reports at that level


  • Select the Label/Label group to include in the report

  • If none are selected, all positions are included based on the other selected criteria

  • Select Class

  • If none are selected, all positions are included based on the other selected criteria

  • After all selections are made, click Get Report



  • Once a Report is generated, the user has another set of specific options to customize the view

    • View - expanded or contracted

    • Grouping on specific criteria in drop-down boxes


  • Right-click on any of the reports, near the report header to export to Adobe (PDF) or Excel (XLS)

Tabular Rollforward

  • Tabular reconciliation of the total amount of unrecognized tax benefit (UTB) at the beginning & end of the period, including detail for

    ‐ Positions identified in Prior Periods

    • Gross amount of increases and decreases to UTB for prior positions

      ‐ Positions identified in the Current Period

    • Gross amount of increases and decreases to UTB for current positions

      ‐ Settlements

    • Decreases to UTB for settlements

      ‐ Statute of Limitations

    • Decreases to UTB for expiration of statute of limitations


Tabular Rollforward

  • ONESOURCE Uncertain Tax Position Application

    • Tabular Payable Rollforward report using the Gross/Benefit Option = “Gross” view

    • Interest & Penalties Classification can be chosen to ensure information is presented accurately

    • Above the Line: Select Show = “Above the Line” or “Above the Line – Interest Only”

    • Below the Line: Select Show = “All”
