Reinventing productivity: taking the robot out of the human




The challenge

  • Numerous tax provision reports generated from ONESOURCE Tax Provision (OTP) are utilized by the tax departments during the period close cycle. Data frequently changes, so the reports must be rerun. Delay in getting the reports to the department has adverse effect on meeting the critical close cycle deadline.

What we did

  • Used RPA to generate tax provision reports from ONESOURCE Tax Provision. The data robot logged into the system, generated, formatted, and uploaded tax provision reports to the tax department’s SharePoint site at a scheduled time and sent email notification.

Why automation

  • During critical quarterly and annual close periods, tax professionals constantly need to run and format reports during the review of the provision, interim provision and estimated payment data. This is time-consuming and the reports are prone to errors if they are done manually.

Outcome

  • Significant time savings, increased speed, accuracy and efficiency (less manual keying of data).

  • Teams were able to spend more time on review and less time on preparation (better leverage of knowledge worker skills).

  • Reduced labor cost.

  • Reduced human errors.

Cognitive



What is it?

  • Combination and transformation of data from disparate sources and formats into meaningful and valuable information

  • Augments instead of just replacing the work being done by a human


When to use?

  • Manual, repetitive steps to transform data

  • Consolidating data from multiple sources

  • Non-tabular data source formats

    Various tools available in the market

  • Two leading tools that can be leveraged without learning a programming language are Microsoft Power Query and Alteryx Designer


    What is it?

    • Self-service data integration tool that is part of Microsoft Excel and Microsoft Power BI

    • Simplifies data discovery, access, refinement and collaboration across the organization

    • Provides a robust “get data” experience from within MS Excel


    How does it work?

  • Records steps applied to transform data; does not require any programming skills

  • Examples of applied steps include remove columns, add custom contingent columns, group data, append tables, merge data, etc.

  • Input data from one or more supported data sources

  • Output results in a clean table format to an Excel worksheet or to data models


    What is it?

    • End-to-end self-service data integration and advance data analytics tool with visual workflow

    • Automates time-consuming, manual tasks while performing predictive, statistical and spatial analytics in the same workflow


    How does it work?

  • Uses drag-drop functionality for preprogrammed mini-macros; does not require any programming skills

  • Input data from one or more supported data sources

  • Can automate all functionality that can be applied in Excel; VLOOKUPS; SUMIFS, etc.

  • Output results to various platforms and file types

  • Does not store any data

      Journal Entry Configuration Options to Meet Your Specific Requirements


      Applying Journal Entry Functionality Within Your Provision Process



      13

      Journal Entry options available in OTP

      • Simple

      • Custom

      • Configurable

      • Journal Entry Profile


        Benefits of Journal Entry automation


      • More efficient than manual processes


      • Simplifies journal entry updates for post-close accounting entries


      • Useful for tax account reconciliation


      • Journal entries are calculated by entity


      • Plug-in reports can be created to build custom output file formats required for uploading into general ledger systems


        Overview of the four Journal Entry Options


        Journal entries are reported only in local (functional) currency for all configuration options


        • Original journal entry process – First introduced in TaxStream

        • Uses a predefined set of tax accounts

        • Simple, predefined output report

        • Not G/L account specific

        • No configuration flexibility


          Utilizes the “Taxes Per Books” fields in Unit Details


          Custom

        • 2nd Generation of the journal entry process

        • Utilizes special system parameter settings

        • Requires a custom built report to define the journal entry line items

        • Provides greater flexibility than the simple method

          Confidential and Proprietary

          Custom JE – Sample Format

          Configurable Journal Entry

        • Offers advanced configuration options

        • Configuration is managed by the user

        • Configuration is required at each unit level

          • Allows unit specific settings

          • Configuration and maintenance can be complex

        • Reporting

          • Predefined set of journal entry reports

          • Plug-in reports can be developed specific to client needs

            Journal Entry Profile

        • Journal entry logic is configured by the user

        • Most flexible and advanced option

        • Leverages the functionality of the configurable JE without the need to configure each unit

        • Plug-in reports can be configured for specific posting requirements

        • Easy to maintain

          • At minimum a single journal entry profile is required

          • Profiles are assigned to units

      • Journal Entry Profile settings are accessible at the dataset administration level

      • Journal Entries configuration is managed at the unit administration level

      • Both methods utilize similar configuration screens

        Journal Entry Logic

      • Incremental Journal Entry

        • Amount required per OTP vs. amount previously recorded per books

        • Requires prior YTD account balances from general ledger

        • Prior YTD balances bridged into OTP to trial balance accounts

      • Full year-to-date journal entry

        • Full YTD amount recorded in each period

        • Prior YTD entry is automatically reversed on the general ledger

        Journal Entry Configuration Prerequisites

      • Identify the G/L accounts required for the JE

      • Define those accounts in Administration and indicate as JE Posting accounts by checking the box at the far right

        Confidential and Proprietary

      • GL amounts can be loaded via the data bridge, the Excel add-in, via import template, or manually entered


      • Create a Journal Entry Profile in Dataset Administration

        Confidential and Proprietary

      • Define the calculation logic for each line



        • A minimum of two configuration lines are required to create a balanced journal

        entry

        Confidential and Proprietary

      • Each line allows identification of the tax value in OTP and the related G/L account balance to which it should be compared



        CFIT Coding

        for Tax and Book calculations

      • Define the tax and book calculation logic for each line



        Confidential and Proprietary


      • Complete the configuration for each line of logic

        Confidential and Proprietary

      • Assign the profile to the appropriate units



      • Finally, test the journal entry output

        Confidential and Proprietary

      • Below is the calculation detail report view



      • Numerous report formats are predefined in OTP

        Confidential and Proprietary

      • Below is the summary by GL account



        Confidential and Proprietary

      • Customized Plug-In reports can be designed to meet business needs such as this pipe delimited format for direct importing into a general ledger system


        Confidential and Proprietary

      • Other formats can be designed as required

        Journal Entry Automation – In Summary

      • OTP JE configuration can address simple or very complex entries

      • Automated journal entries can accelerate the tax close

      • Eliminates manual calculation errors

      • Facilitates incremental JE calculations for post-close accounting entries that affect tax provision entries previously posted

      • Configuration is maintained at the dataset level so it can be updated or enhanced when changes are required without impacting prior periods



        Confidential and Proprietary


        Payable Transactions and Rollforward Report Configuration Options


        Taking Advantage of OTP’s Advanced Payable Functionality



        35


        Utilizing OTP Payable Functionality

        Payable Functionality Overview

      • The Payable function in OTP allows users to perform the payable reconciliation within OTP.

      • Tracking of federal and state payments, refunds and tax accruals can be performed for each respective unit or the consolidated group for each respective tax year all within OTP

        Payable Functionality Overview

      • Payable activity can be automatically tracked by jurisdiction and tax year

      • OTP’s automated return to provision process automatically adjusts the appropriate liability year

      • Payable “buckets” can be created to track other items such as FIN 48 liabilities

        Payable Functionality — Prerequisites

      • Payable functionality does not require any additional license; the functionality is part of OTP

      • GL payable accounts should be reconciled prior to loading data in OTP

      • Identify the payable buckets required

        • UTP

        • Tax Refunds, etc.


      • By default, OTP accrues the current tax provision to the payable rollforward

      • The Return Basis Provision and RTP entries are automatically offset to the payable account



      • The default functionality provides a good foundation to create a simple payable reconciliation in OTP

      • To complete the process, enter the following

        • Payable beginning balances for each unit and jurisdiction

        • Current G/L year transactions not generated by OTP


          • Cash payments

          • Refunds

          • Intercompany settlements

          • Etc.


      • Example of payable entries



        Confidential and Proprietary

      • Report results – The RTP of $4,492,600 automatically offsets against the correct tax year


        Confidential and Proprietary

        Examples of pre-populated Transaction Types in OTP

        If creating a new rollup and a corresponding transaction code, the rollup has to be created first as it is a required field when creating a

        new transaction code

        Manage Payable Transactions Type

        The payable transaction type identifies the nature of transaction that is being recorded to the payable.


      • The Transaction Types can be seen on the Payable Report below under their respective Rollup code


  • Manage Payable Buckets

  • The payable bucket function allows users to create additional groupings on the payable report to assign transactions. The buckets appear as columns on the payable report. The best use of the buckets is when there are separate G/L accounts for federal, state and foreign payable accounts or even UTP tracking.

  • The use of buckets also allows the configuration of the journal entry so that transactions can be posted to their respective G/L accounts based on the nature of the transaction for example; UTP vs. taxes payable


  • Other Payable Configurations options can be selected in the Administration tab under System/Manage Configuration/Advanced Functionality/Payable



  • Enable Payable Summary Entry – Version 2014

    • The Payable Summary Entry option allows both Federal and State payable entries to be entered in the same screen for all units instead of going to each unit’s respective Federal and/or State payable tab



  • Enable Payable Reclass Tab

    • Selecting “Yes” for this option creates a tab in the Payable Summary Entry section of each dataset. This allows for manual reclass entries from one unit or jurisdiction to another. Items entered on the Reclass tab can only be saved when the "Amount Total" nets to zero for items on the page. Before entries can be made to the Reclass tab, transaction types need to be created in the Payable Settings.


  • Dataset Parameters – Payable Reclass

    • Dataset parameter – PAYRECTYPE – entered in the dataset administration allows the settlement of payable balances from one unit to another

    • The target unit is defined at the Unit Administration level using the parameter PAYRECUNIT to identify the target unit for the transfer

    • Depending on the PAYRECTYPE option setting, Option 1 allows for the federal and state payable balances to be transferred to the same unit defined at the Unit Admin level. Option 2 allows a different target unit to be specified in the Unit/State administration level


  • Plug-In Reports

    • The default payable reports in OTP can meet the needs of many users but because of their limited flexibility, plug-in reports may be created to address business needs

    • Following are some examples requested by OTP users


Payable Output (Review)

  • The payable output report enhances the standard OTP Payable Rollforward report (using the Jurisdiction Type-Jurisdiction-Year display option). This report will breakout amounts not only by the rollup codes (columns) but also by bucket entries per entity type.

Confidential and Proprietary


Payable Breakout Report

  • This customized OTP report will produce a listing of each payable transaction detailed by unit. The default report contained in OTP would only display the payable transactions at a consolidated level.



    Payable – State Components

  • This customized OTP report will produce detail payable information for each entity in a format that can be reloaded to the payable module (the format of the report mirrors the #SL# worksheet for a dataset import. This report will provide a more granular level of detail for the payable module vs. capturing all data within CPROV. The report will include the following:

    • an offset to the CPROV entry for each unit/state combination

    • State current tax

    • ATTDs

    • Cash Tax Adjustments

    • Non-Cash Tax Adjustments (excluding NC_RTP, NC_OTHER since these flow automatically)


In Summary

  • OTP offers extensive payable configuration options

  • The payable functionality can be utilized to track payable activity at a very high level or…

  • At a very granular level by taking advantage of OTP’s advanced configuration options

  • OTP payable functionality is scalable

    • Utilization can be refined and expanded as business needs change

    • Useful for foreign data capture via the Global Access Module

    • Able to provide accurate, detailed reports for auditors


Applying Journal Entry and Payable Functionality Within Your Provision Process




59


Applying Journal Entry and Payable Functionality Within Your Provision Process

  • Journal entry configuration options and outputs

  • Enhanced payable configuration

  • Plug-in report capabilities

  • Improved process and efficiencies

    Challenges With Tags and the Benefits From Classes




    8


    Challenges With Tags and the Benefits From Classes

    THIS IS KEVIN’S SLIDE – LET’S HELP HIM ON THIS


  • Challenges with Tags

    • Limited set of Tag options

    • Limited security controls around Tags and their use

    • Tags are universal in OTP; functionality can not be customized to a reporting period

    • Rollforward structures are very cryptic and difficult to update

  • Benefits of Converting to Classes

    • Class and subclass codes are descriptive and can be easy to understand

    • Classes can be created for one time transactions in a reporting period but do not need to be carried over to future datasets

    • Classes provide greater options for Payable and Journal Entry functionality

    • Many reports can be run with data limited to specific Classes or Class Groups

    • Security is greatly enhanced for Classes for both user access and usage



      Confidential and Proprietary

      9


      Overview of Tag vs Class Functionality




      10

      Tags vs Classes Datasets


  • Tag Datasets

    • 26 Letters of the Alphabet

      • Limited to less that full alphabet due to tags defined for OTP use

        • A – Automated Adjustments

        • F – FIN 48

        • G – GAAP to STAT

        • R – Return to Provision

    • Used to define data entry and deferred rollforward structure

      • Deferred Balances and NOL rollforward can have different rollforward configuration

      • Rollforward configuration can be a challenge to understand

    • Limited flexibility

      • Can restrict access to read/write users

      • Limited reporting use


        Confidential and Proprietary


  • Manage Rollforwards – Tag Configuration


    Confidential and Proprietary


  • Tag Configuration – Limited options to restrict access and use



  • Tag could be named but settings are universal across all datasets



  • Class Datasets

    • Unlimited options

      • Classes are user defined text

      • Each class has one or more subclasses defined

      • Virtually any descriptive code can be created

      • Classes are assigned to datasets

        • Classes can be created for specific transactions

        • Can be excluded from subsequent period datasets

    • Subclasses

      • Provide additional granularity for data input

      • Do not provide additional reporting capabilities


  • Class Datasets

    • User friendly – descriptions rather than cryptic letters

      • Classes can use descriptive text, i.e.

        • 2017FEDAUDIT – 2017 Federal Audit Settlement

        • ACQ_ABC – Acquisition of ABC Company

    • ConfiguraProvides greater possibilities for data use

      • Can store both beginning and ending trial balances in one dataset

    • Enhanced functionality

      • ble Journal Entry

      • Payable

Tags vs Classes Datasets

      Class Applications for the Configurable Journal Entry and Payable Functionality



      30


  • Classes provide an additional filter that can be used for Journal Entry configuration

  • Journal Entry profiles can be limited to a single class or group of classes



  • Journal Entry profiles can be limited to a single class or group of classes

    • Allows configuration of JE lines to post specific tax components to unique accounts

      • NOL

      • Valuation Allowances

      • Tax Contingencies

      • Other Comprehensive Income

    • With tags, it was necessary to back out specific transactions from total tax components in order to post them separately

    • Classes allow mapping specific types of transactions without the need for complicated journal entry logic


  • Class datasets permit the mapping of ALL non-cash tax adjustments (with a prefix of NC_) to the payable – From My Datasets, select More, then Tax Adjustment Payable Mapping Data Review

    Confidential and Proprietary

  • By creating additional payable buckets combined with mapping non-cash tax adjustments, the payable can be used to track more than just the current tax liability


  • Payable Results


    Confidential and Proprietary


    Transfer Balances from One Unit to Another




    35


    Balance Transfers Between Units

  • If an entity is dissolved or merged, OTP is able to transfer the Payable and Deferred Balances from one unit to another

  • This function only operates in Class Datasets

  • To activate the transfer, select a Unit, select MORE, then select Properties



  • On the GENERAL tab, select Activate Transfer Tab

  • This activates the tab with the Transfer Wizard

  • Transfer Classes must be created to enable the transfer




  • Next, start the Transfer Wizard


  • After clicking Next, the data components that can be transferred appears

  • Select all or those that should be transferred



    Confidential and Proprietary


  • If Yes is selected for the Review Transfer Temp Diffs data, the screen on the

    next slide will appear

    Confidential and Proprietary


  • This screen summarizes the data to be transferred




  • Click the check box on the final screen to initiate the data transfer


  • The results of the transfer can be seen on the data entry screen

  • The transfer classes can be assigned to specific columns in the deferred rollforward



  • The same process can be applied to Payable balances as well

    OTP Class Structure and Assignment

  • Create custom Class/Subclass combinations in Administration as needed

  • Export selected datasets for conversion

  • Use the vlookup in Excel to assign the Class/Subclass codes to their corresponding tags

    • This may create records with duplicate codes

    • Combine records with duplicative coding as necessary;

  • Create an empty class dataset

  • Import recoded dataset into class dataset

  • Use the Tax Provision Unit Comparison report to compare the remapped dataset to the original

    OTP Class Structure and Assignment

  • Other Considerations for converting to Classes

    • In order to use the RTP auto-posting functionality of OTP, all datasets used for RTP must be Class datasets

      • Prior Tax Return Dataset

      • Prior Tax Provision Dataset

      • Current Period RTP Target Dataset

    • Workpapers and Active Workpapers can perform GET’s and SET’s of data using Classes

    • The GET function can not read calculated values at the Class or Class group level (at least at this time)

      OTP Class Structure andAssignment

  • Other Considerations for converting to Classes (Continued)

    • Reporting dataset functionality can not combine Tag and Class datasets

    • Tag datasets can not be used as the Copy source when creating a new Class Dataset


In Summary




54


In Summary

Advantages of Class Datasets

  • Simplifies OTP Configuration and Data Entry

    • Classes have meaningful descriptions

    • Manage Rollforwards

  • Improved Reporting

    • Class Groups – Ordinary vs discrete activity

    • Available on Tax Provision, ETR, and Deferred Balances reports

  • Expanded Payable Functionality

    • Tax Account Mapping – Create payable buckets for additional liabilities

      • Class – Every NC_ adjustment code can be mapped to accrue to specific payable transaction codes and buckets

        • Track liability accounts for UTP, taxes receivable, etc.

        • Classes allow mapping the same NC_ adjustment to different places depending on the company or jurisdiction

  • Company Balance Transfers

    • Transfer liability accounts for dissolved entities

    • Can be applied to payable and deferred balances

  • Journal Entry - Classes can be used to fine tune JE configuration

ONESOURCE

Workpapers (f.k.a. Active Workpapers)


  • Retrieve ("Get") data out of ONESOURCE for use in excel based provision calculations

  • Push ("Set") data into ONESOURCE (e.g. M adjustments, NOLs, etc.)



    Workpaper Batch


    • Recalculate workpapers used in provision calculation in a defined order to drive automation between Workpapers and OTP calculations


      Batch Reporting

    • Set up consistent reports that can be utilized multiple times to direct different reporting needs (e.g. consolidation, IFRS, state combined, etc.)


      Payable

      • Maintain payable in ONESOURCE seizing automation within software and eliminating heavy reliance on offline excel work papers


        Journal Entry Automation

  • Set up journal entry parameters for ONESOURCE to automatically maintain the tax journal entry

Data Wrangling

Data wrangling is the process of transforming raw data into a workable format

  • Data is aggregated from multiple sources and in different formats

  • Rulesets are applied to align, enrich and prepare the data for effective use

  • Cleansed data is loaded into downstream systems

  • Repeatable workflows are set up to run rulesets and effectively automate the data wrangling process

Leverage ONESOURCE’s functionality to establish the core metadata elements used in all down stream processes

Leverage data wrangling to not only create data reconciliation, validation, and exception reports but also proactively creating load templates for new metadata elements

Establish standardized Master Data tables utilizing ONESOURCE functionality to house all data needed for reporting

Not only achieve reduction of hours within the preparation cycle, but also create impactful automated audit ready workpapers packages

Robotic Process Automation (RPA) will allow the push of a button to create WPs, PDFs of returns, and Efile XMLs that can be validated, reconciled and reviewed in mass

Combining standardization of data and process with RPA tools will allow for us to easily create repeatable customized reporting packages

ONESOURCE

DATA WRANGLING



Data blending Reporting Value Added


Offers data prep and data blending capabilities through an intuitive user interface that is faster than traditional approaches and takes coding out of the equation.


Access to all your relevant data

Connect to and cleanse data from databases, cloud applications, spreadsheets and disparate data sources


Prep and blend the right data

Create the right dataset for analysis or visualization using the data quality, integration and transformation tools. Enrich your data with tax metadata such as legal entity, sub groups, entity type, country, region and other attributes to enable reporting capabilities

Enables the user to develop reports and mail to recipients in a single workflow that can be scheduled. Workflows can be expanded to an app which has a user friendly interface for the business analyst to run.


Output to various databases and Formats Databases output to Oracle, SQL, Access or file formats such as Microsoft Excel, PDF, ESRI, XML


Create and Schedule Reports

Simple creation of custom reports that can be refreshed on demand or scheduled


Fuel your visualization tools

Reduce time to create the perfect dataset for visualization and analytics

Streamline your tax processes by minimizing the need for manual manipulation and transformation of data used in tax computations and analysis. Workflows can be created to automate repetitive data transformation tasks, perform validations, generate reports and feed visualization tools.


Examples of Data Wrangling use in tax


Trial balance transformation: standard chart of accounts rollup, entity mappings, new entity and account identification, financial consolidation system reconciliation, direct output to tax workpapers and tax system import templates


State apportionment: blending of state apportionment data from various sources, validations, reconciliation to trial balance and allocations of differences, output to tax workpapers and tax system import templates


Tool

Description

Example

Select

Select, deselect, reorder, and rename fields

Selecting x number of fields or certain data in a dataset

Join

Combine two inputs from two or more sets of data, based on a related piece between them

Combining 2 data sources based on a unique customer ID

Union

Combine two or more data streams with similar structures based on field names or positions

Combining 2 periods of data such as Prior Year and Current Year

Filter/Where

Extract data that fulfill a specific condition

Query only domestic customers from a database

Sort/Order By

Arranges data based on one or more fields

Ascending/Descending order by amount of sales
